sen.j: （平安京創生館）朱雀大路（すざくおおじ）は、古代東アジアにおける首都内の官道名で、条坊制の都市において宮城・官衙の正面から南方にむかう道のこと。
sen.e: (Kyoto City Heiankyo Sosei-kan Museum) The Suzakuoji broad avenue is referred to as a government-run road in capitals of ancient East Asia under a street plan of ancient capital, which ran southward from the front of the Kyujo (place where Emperor lives) and Kanga (government office).

(Kyoto City Heiankyo Sosei-kan Museum) The Suzakuoji broad avenue is referred to as a government-run road in capitals of ancient East Asia under a street plan of ancient capital, which ran southward from the front of the Kyujo (place where Emperor lives) and Kanga (government office).
sen.cmt: Robert: "The Suzakuoji broad avenue is referred to as a government-run road in capitals of ancient East Asia under a street plan of ancient capital," This doesn't make much sense.
sen.e: (Kyoto City Heiankyo Sosei-kan Museum) The Suzaku-oji Street is referred to as a government-run road in capitals of ancient East Asia under a street plan of ancient capital, which ran southward from the front of the Kyujo (place where Emperor lives) and Kanga (government office).

sen.j: 名称は南方の守護神である朱雀にちなむ。
sen.e: The name comes from a tutelary deity called Suzaku (red Chinese phoenix) living in southern regions.
sen.cmt: 守護神 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: The name comes from a tutelary deity called Suzaku (red Chinese phoenix) living in the southern regions.
The name comes from a tutelary deity called Suzaku (red Chinese phoenix) living in the southern regions.

sen.j: 中国唐王朝時代の条坊制に基づいた長安に始まり、冊封制度により周辺諸国に波及。
sen.e: Such a street under the street plan of ancient capital, which originated in Changan of Tang dynasty period, China, became popular in neighboring countries under the system of Sakuho System (System conferring a peerage with a Saku paper.
sen.cmt: 長安 英辞郎 on the WEBhttp://dic.yahoo.co.jp/dsearch?enc=UTF-8&p=冊封&dtype=0&dname=0na&stype=0&pagenum=1&index=0845670724340
sen.e: Such streets, which were based on the street plans of the ancient capital, and which originated in Changan of Tang dynasty period, China, became popular in neighboring countries under the system of Sakuho System (System conferring a peerage with a Saku paper.)
sen.cmt: Edited for flow/Robert:"System conferring a peerage with a Saku paper." Doesn’t make sense
sen.e: Such streets, which were based on the street plans of the ancient capital, and which originated in Changan of Tang dynasty period, China, became popular in neighboring countries under the system of Sakuho System (System conferring a peerage with a Saku paper).

sen.j: 日本にも遣隋使、遣唐使を通じて条坊制が伝わり、最初の整備都市藤原京造営時に採用された。
sen.e: The plan was introduced into Japan through Japanese official diplomatic delegations sent to China during the Sui and Tang dynasty and first adopted for Fujiwarakyo Capital, which is the first city developed based on a city planning.
sen.cmt: 遣隋使, 遣唐使 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: The plan was introduced into Japan through official Japanese diplomatic delegations sent to China during the Sui and Tang dynasty and was first adopted for Fujiwarakyo Capital, which was the first city developed based on a city plan.

The plan was introduced into Japan through official Japanese diplomatic delegations sent to China during the Sui and Tang dynasty and was first adopted for Fujiwarakyo Capital, which was the first city developed based on a city plan.

sen.j: しかし、当時の持統天皇は朱雀大路の役割を理解せず、2,30メートルほどの小路に造ってしまった。
sen.e: However, the first Suzakuoji broad avenue developed by then Emperor Jito was only about 2. 30 meters wide because of the Emperor's incomplete understanding of the role of Suzakuoji broad avenue.

However, the first Suzakuoji broad avenue developed by then Emperor Jito was only about 2. 30 meters wide due to the Emperor's incomplete understanding of the role Suzakuoji broad avenue was supposed to play.
However, the first Suzaku-oji Street developed by then Emperor Jito was only about 2.30 meters wide due to the Emperor's incomplete understanding of the role Suzaku-oji Street was supposed to play.
sen.cmt: 朱雀大路の表記修正スペース削除

sen.j: そのため人の行き来が窮屈になり、その上天皇への閲兵式、凱旋行進が出来ない状態となった。
sen.e: So there was barely enough space for many people to pass by and furthermore military parades and victory drives were not able to be shown to the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 閲兵式, 凱旋行進 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: There was barely enough space for people to pass by and furthermore military parades and victory drives could not be carried out in front of the Emperor.
There was barely enough space for people to pass by and furthermore military parades and victory drives could not be carried out in front of the Emperor.

sen.j: 後の平城京、平安京はこうした欠陥をなくし、数十メートル単位の大路に造営。
sen.e: This shortcoming was corrected in subsequent Heijokyo and Heiankyo so that the street was widened to more than dozens of meters.
This shortcoming was corrected in subsequent Heijokyo and Heiankyo so that the street was widened to more than several tens of meters.
This shortcoming was corrected in subsequent Heijokyo and Heiankyo so that the street was widened to more than several tens of meters.

sen.j: 都を南北に走り、首都正門羅城門に始まり、大内裏正門朱雀門に終わる。
sen.e: The street running north-south started from the Capital's front gate of Rajomon Gate and finished at the front gate of Dai-dairi (place of the Imperial Palace and government offices) of Suzakumon Gate.

The street running north-south started from the Capital's front gate of Rajomon Gate and finished at the front gate of Dai-dairi (place of the Imperial Palace and government offices) of Suzakumon Gate.

The street running north-south started from the Capital's front gate of Rajomon Gate and finished at the front gate of Dai-dairi (place of the Imperial Palace and government offices) of Suzakumon Gate.

sen.j: しかし律令制の崩壊、天皇政治の没落に伴い次第に市街地の整備もされなくなった。
sen.e: With the end of Ritsuryo system (system of centralized governance) and the decline of Imperial government, however, the district around the avenue began to left neglected. When the center of the city was moved to the east, the Suzakuoji broad avenue ended its role of the central avenue.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: With the end of the Ritsuryo system (system of centralized governance) and the decline of the Imperial government, however, the district around the avenue began to be neglected. When the center of the city was moved to the east, Suzakuoji broad avenue ceased to play a role as central avenue.
With the end of the Ritsuryo system (system of centralized governance) and the decline of the Imperial government, however, the district around the street began to be neglected.
sen.cmt: avenue→street一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 都の中心も東へ移動し既に朱雀大路は中央通りとしての役割を果たさなくなった。
sen.e: When the center of the city was moved to the east, Suzaku-oji Street ceased to play a role as central street.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処avenue→street

sen.j: 大宰府においては政庁地区からのびる中央南北大路のことを平城京・平安京の例にならい朱雀大路と呼ぶこともある。
sen.e: In Dazaifu, some call the central north-south avenue extending from the government district Suzakuoji broad avenue, following the example of Heijokyo and Heiankyo.
In Dazaifu, some call the central north-south avenue extending from the government district Suzakuoji broad avenue, following the example of Heijokyo and Heiankyo.
In Dazaifu, some call the central north-south street extending from the government district Suzaku-oji Street, following the example of Heijokyo and Heiankyo.

sen.j: 中国でも宋 (王朝)の時代に入ると条坊制に基づいた都はあまり作られなくなり、朱雀大路も見られなくなった。
sen.e: In and after the Sung dynasty era in China, the development of the capital under the street plan of ancient capital became unpopular and the Sujaku-dori Street became uncommon.
sen.cmt: 宋 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: In and after the Sung dynasty era in China, the development of the capital under the ancient capital street plan became unpopular and Sujaku-dori Street became uncommon.
In and after the Sung dynasty era in China, the development of the capital under the ancient capital street plan became unpopular and Suzaku-dori Street became uncommon.
